intro: Selago dolichonema, commonly known as the slender selago, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and bloom during the cooler months. Selago dolichonema is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
